briefTitle: Prevention of Malaria in HIV-uninfected Pregnant Women and Infants

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Pregnancy confirmed by positive urine pregnancy test or intrauterine pregnancy by ultrasound
* Estimated gestational age between 12-20 weeks
* Confirmed to be HIV uninfected by rapid test
* 16 years of age or older
* Resident of Busia District, Uganda
* Provision of informed consent by the pregnant woman for herself and her unborn child
* Agreement to come to the study clinic for any febrile episode or other illness and avoid medications given outside the study protocol
* Plan to deliver in the hospital

Exclusion Criteria:

* History of serious adverse event to SP or DP
* Active medical problem requiring inpatient evaluation at the time of screening
* Intention of moving outside of Busia District, Uganda
* Chronic medical condition requiring frequent medical attention
* Prior SP preventive therapy or any other antimalarial therapy during this pregnancy
* Early or active labor (documented by cervical change with uterine contractions)

outcomeMeasures.title: Number of Participants Who Deliver With a Composite Adverse Birth Outcome
outcomeMeasures.description: Composite adverse birth outcome defined as any one of the following: 1) Low birth weight (\< 2500 gm); 2) Preterm delivery (\< 37 weeks gestational age); 3) Small for gestational age (\< 10th percentile relative to an external growth reference)

outcomeMeasures.title: Mean Gestational Age in Weeks at Birth
outcomeMeasures.description: Gestational age in weeks determined by ultrasound dating (gold standard) and by the metabolic profiling outcome from biological specimens including placental tissue and placental blood.

outcomeMeasures.title: Prevalence of Placental Malaria by Histology
outcomeMeasures.description: Any evidence of placental infection (parasites or pigment). Number of participants with placental tissue positive for malaria parasites or pigment.

outcomeMeasures.title: Prevalence of Placental Parasitemia
outcomeMeasures.description: Proportion of placental blood samples positive for parasites by Loop-mediated isothermal amplification (LAMP) or microscopy

outcomeMeasures.title: Prevalence of Maternal Malaria
outcomeMeasures.description: Maternal blood positive for malaria parasites by microscopy.

outcomeMeasures.title: Number of Participants With Adverse Events
Prevalence of Anemia in Pregnant Women
Prevalence of Anemia in Infants
outcomeMeasures.description:
Defined as the proportion with hemoglobin \< 10 g/dL measure routinely at 12, 28, and 52 weeks of age. Number of cases per person year (PPY).

This is a prevalence measure but are repeated measures during infancy. In other words we measured this outcome up to 3 times for each participant during infancy (at 12, 28 and 52 weeks of age).

outcomeMeasures.title: Prevalence of Asymptomatic Parasitemia in Pregnant Women
outcomeMeasures.description: Proportion of routine monthly samples positive for parasites by microscopy and LAMP

outcomeMeasures.title: Prevalence of Asymptomatic Parasitemia in Infants
outcomeMeasures.description: Proportion of routine monthly samples positive for parasites by microscopy and LAMP

outcomeMeasures.title: Incidence of Complicated Malaria in Infants
outcomeMeasures.description: Complicated malaria defined as an episode of malaria with danger signs (any of the following: less than 3 convulsions over 24 h, inability to sit or stand, vomiting everything, unable to breastfeed or drink) or the meeting standardized criteria for severe malaria.

outcomeMeasures.title: Incidence of Hospital Admissions in Infants
outcomeMeasures.description: Admission to the pediatric ward for any cause
